result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontae R. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied. 
*  Pay DNA surcharge.  
Deft not permitted out during hours of darkness with the exception of work or in company of wife during first 6 months of supervision.  Agent will have authority to make reasonable exceptions.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  Not to unlawfully operate a motor vehicle.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devontae R. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  15CM62/15CM285.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (PO Hold) w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Cases are resolved.  

15CM62 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.

15CM285 - deft pleads guilty to count 2 (BJ); found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years each count concurrent.  See conditions.
Bond to apply to financial obligations; any balance to be returned to poster.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Chavez appeared on behalf of the deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ due to ongoing trial (NOTE - deft on a PO Hold).  Mutual request for an adjournment; new complaint forthcoming.  FPT 3/24/15 @ 11:15am, JS 4/13/15 @ 9am
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Krejcarek

159 p.m.  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clk  LE.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  PTC on 1/30/15 @ 145 p.m. & FPT on 2/26/15 @ 940 a.m. & JS on 3/16/15 @ 9 a.m.  $100 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

CONTINUED POSTED
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Daryl K. H, Jr. or his residence other than at work.
961.41(3g)(e) -Poss of THC, Repeater
